H0.text: What gambling game takes its name from French for toad, supposedly from players' hunched positions. Roulette

H1.text: What gambling game takes its name from French for toad, supposedly from players' hunched positions. Baccarat

H2.text: What gambling game takes its name from French for toad, supposedly from players' hunched positions. Trente et Quarante

H3.text: What gambling game takes its name from French for toad, supposedly from players' hunched positions. Craps

A4.text: Baccarat Banque is the earliest form of baccarat; it is a three-person game and mentioned in Album des jeux by Charles Vanâ€‘Tenac.

A5.text: Punto banco is nowadays the most played version of baccarat in the United States.

A6.text: Ivey won $500,000 playing craps using his gains as a stake in the game.
